de.fhluebeck.group3.DAO

Class BaseDAO

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.fhluebeck.group3.DAO.BaseDAO

  • public final class BaseDAO
extends java.lang.Object
    BaseDAO as the Factory Model. This class is mainly responsible for MYSQL database connection, which sets the connection parameters, load the driver at the beginning of the system and provides functions for acquiring and closing DB connections.
    Author:
    Yichen.Hua on 2018/05/22.

      Fill in the wild-cards with attribute in the Object[] and Execute SQL query, returns a boolean attribute.

                                         throws java.sql.SQLException
        Provider the external classes with the valid DB connections.
        Returns:
        connection valid database connection.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when connection is not available.

      • closeAll

        public static void closeAll(java.sql.Connection conn,
                            java.sql.Statement stmt,
                            java.sql.ResultSet rs)
                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Provider the external classes with the close function of DB connections resources.
        Parameters:
        conn - DB Connection.
        stmt - Statement.
        rs - ResultSet.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when SQLException occurs.

      • executeQuery

        public static java.sql.ResultSet executeQuery(java.sql.PreparedStatement preparedSql,
                                              java.lang.Object[] param)
                                       throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Fill in the wild-cards with attribute in the Object[] and Execute SQL query, returns the result set. Note that you do have to close the resources by calling our closeAll function.
        Parameters:
        preparedSql: - raw SQL statements with wild-cards.
        param: - parameters to fill in the wild-cards.
        Returns:
        ResultSet: SQL querying results.
        Throws:
        ClassNotFoundException: - when the driver class is not found.
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

      • executeSql

        public static boolean executeSql(java.lang.String preparedSql,
                                 java.lang.Object[] param)
                          throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Fill in the wild-cards with attribute in the Object[] and Execute SQL query, returns a boolean attribute. Note that you do not have to close the resources since they are automatically closed by us.
        Parameters:
        preparedSql: - raw SQL statements with wild-cards.
        param: - parameters to fill in the wild-cards.
        Returns:
        boolean - flag that shows whether sql is executed successfully.
        Throws:
        ClassNotFoundException: - when the driver class is not found.
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
